Key Match Events: Cole Palmer scored the opening goal from the penalty spot after a VAR decision.
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored England's second goal with a swerving volley.
Harry Kane scored the third goal to make the scoreline more respectable.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate aimed for a successful summer as England took on Bosnia & Herzegovina in a pre-Euro 2024 friendly.
The match was a chance for fringe players like Jarrod Bowen, Cole Palmer, Eberechi Eze, and Trent Alexander-Arnold to make their case for the final squad.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate was satisfied with the performance, noting the physical challenge and praising the displays of Eberechi Eze and Cole Palmer.
Southgate highlighted the importance of getting through the match without new injuries and gaining a clearer picture of the squad.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at St James' Park, Newcastle, with a near-sellout crowd of 50,061.
Newcastle United fan group Wor Flags delivered an impressive pre-game display.
Kieran Trippier, the Newcastle captain, was cheered enthusiastically as he captained England for the night.
Others: England's next friendly match is against Iceland on June 7, 2024, before their Euro 2024 group-phase opener against Serbia on June 16, 2024.
